text: I've found myself spending quite a bit
of time at the airport these days wonder
frustrations I found was actually
waiting and queues a lot both its
security waiting to check in bags so I
was thinking wouldn't it be nice if
there was a better way of being able
just to breeze through security without
having to go through all that rigmarole
but at the same time maintaining the
same level of security to ensure you are
who you say you are using services like
Lex and using services like recognition
we can automate a lot of the typical
interaction with humans or agents within
many different types of systems and one
of the things I really like about Lex is
that it removes that monitor in front of
the user and doesn't force them to fill
out a form they can now just have a
conversation with a computer and using
things like recognition that would help
drive some of the additional security
requirements because you've got a single
point of truth to say I can verify this
person is who they say they are so
really the main focus would be on kind
of easing that trouble experience making
it become a lot slicker a lot quicker so
they can actually go from arriving at
the airport through to go into the gate
without having to spend an hour in
security
[Music]
you
